intro: Andropogon diversiflorus, commonly known as the diverseflower bluestem, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, blue-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive blue-green hue, contributing to its ornamental value. Andropogon diversiflorus plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
